intro: Isoetes variabilis var. tenuissima, commonly known as the slender water horsetail, is a rare aquatic plant belonging to the Equisetaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, needle-like leaves and is typically found in shallow, still waters with sandy or muddy substrates. The plant produces a spore-bearing cone at the apex of its stem, which is a key feature of its reproductive biology. It thrives in nutrient-poor environments and is often associated with wetlands and ponds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in many regions.
